data.title: Top 20 Product Based Companies in World 2024
data.meta_description: A Computer Science portal for geeks. It contains well written, well thought and well explained computer science and programming articles, quizzes and practice/competitive programming/company interview Questions.
data.text:
As per stats, people who move into product-based companies get more hike than service-based employees. The average increment scale is above 25% which is comparatively more than a service-based company i.e. 6-20%. That’s the main reason why working in Product-based companies is more desirable for IT people.

Now let us look at the top companies you can work for and brighten up your career. In this article, we have enlisted the top 20 companies that hire actively with great perks and work-life balance. So, without further ado, let us begin!

Land your dream job in a product-based company with our ‘Data Structures and Algorithms – Self Paced course

Top 20 Product Based Companies in World 2024

1. Microsoft

An American Multi-National Technology Company that actively works in the field of software, personal computers, electronic items, etc. Some of the most notable products introduced by Microsoft are MS Cloud, Security, Dynamic 365, Microsoft Industry, Office 365, etc. It was founded by Bill Gates and Paul Allen, in 1975, with HQ in Redmond, Washington, United States

Current Strength: 221,000

Previous Year Hiring: 10,000 (*in 2023)

Current Hiring: 824 (India) / 31330 (Global) / 5324 (Official Website)

How to Apply:

Official Website – Microsoft Careers

LinkedIn – Microsoft (LinkedIn)

2. Amazon

It is a vast Internet-based world’s largest enterprise retailer and a prominent cloud service provider (AWS) and has millions of customers worldwide. It has been dominant in the market for years now in cloud computing, AI, digital streaming, etc. It was founded by Jeff Bezos, in 1994, with HQ in Seattle, Washington, U.S.A

Current Strength: 1.525 million (*as of December 2023)

Previous Year Hiring: 23,500 (*in 2023)

Current Hiring: 9121 (India) / 50,371 (Global) / 1000+ (Official Website)

How to Apply:

LinkedIn – Amazon (LinkedIn)

3. Google

One of the best product-based companies is known for its vast categories such as search engines, cloud computing, and hardware. It was founded by Larry Page and Sergey Brin in 1998 and the HQ is in Mountain View, California. It still leads the charts and is possibly the first preference for every working professional.

Current Strength: 1,78,000+ (*as of 2023 stats)

4. Intel

Founded in 1968 by Gordon Moore and Robert Noyce, and as of today, this company is well-known for developing the microprocessors which are found in most of the world’s personal computers. Some of the most notable products developed by Intel are Xeon Scalable Processors, Intel Core, Pentium, etc. The company’s HQ is in Santa Clara, California, and the word “Intel” was derived from – Intelligent Information.

If you’re looking for a way into a product-based company, then the best way to give a kick-start is by joining a Complete Test Series for Product-Based Companies (Interview Preparation course) and getting yourself a job-ready professional.

Conclusion

This was the list of the Top 20 Product based companies that are leading the chart on a global level and offering wide opportunities for software developers. Opting for a career in product-based companies, as highlighted by the article, proves to be financially rewarding with an average increment in salary exceeding 25%, which is much higher than the growth observed in service-based companies. For those aspiring to enhance their careers, exploring opportunities in these leading companies is a promising path.
